p: Total polyphenols are 444.3–1591 mg/kg in garlic ( A. sativum L.), chives ( A. schoenoprasum L.), ramson ( A. ursinum L.) and red, yellow and white onion ( A. cepa L.) which decline in the order of chives > red onion > garlic > yellow onion > ramson > white onion (Lenková et al. 2016). Phytochemical analysis of A. cepa L. and A. cornutum using high-performance liquid chromatography (HPLC), showed that two quercetin conjugates, (1) and (2), account for about 80% of the total flavonol content in both onions (Fredotović et al. 2017).
